main event: An object was observed in Bettles, Alaska on 8 February 1953, exhibiting stationary characteristics before rapidly accelerating.
interesting points: The object had a yellowish fin that may have been caused by contracting metal.,The object was light inside and left a trail of billowing smoke approximately 5 miles long.,Estimates of the object's speed were made at around 200 MPH.,The object was viewed for a total of 2 minutes.,Attempts were made to measure the object's speed for about 40 seconds before it accelerated.
sighted object: a needle-like object with a yellowish fin
